reviews.review: No principles of Sikhism. Whilst on my honeymoon, myself and my wife decided to take time out and visit this gurdwara. It is such a beautiful gurdwara inside and out and we understand why so many people want to visit this place of worship.Unfortunately soon as we walked in a security guard came running up and told me I was dressed inappropriately as my knee length shorts were not long enough and would have to wear a pair of trousers which he provided; given I was in a place of worship I didn't want to argue the fact that Singhs wear long shorts with their Bana (religious clothing) but hey I was here to pray and not argue so I accepted the trousers and made my way upstairs.We sat in the darbar hall and there was just Kirtan being played over the PA system. We sat there for a short while meditating and doing our own personal prayers. Once we got up we seen a few boards outside the darbar hall with information on therefore we started reading these and the more and more we read it seemed like this gurdwara was being treated like a tourist attraction rather than a place of worship, it seemed as if the committee members were more concerned about impressing public figures rather than practicing the core values of Sikhism.As we waited for the taxi driver to finish eating langar we noticed a large school bus arrive with a handful of children. They took a few pictures against a poster and then the children, their teachers and the gurdwara staff (security guard and committee members) formed a line from the school bus which was outside the front door, up the front steps and to a room next to the front doors. They were passing parcels which were hand wrapped with wrapping paper and looked like gifts. Only problem is the school kids and teachers were passing these gifts with care to each other, however once it reached the security guard inside the front door and out of view of the children and teachers they were being tossed to the next committee members who was throwing them onto the floor in a room.As I looked on with utter shock and frustration they continued with this practice for some time. I decided to do the right thing and approach the security guard and asked who are these gifts from, to which he replied from the school and their kids. I then expressed my concerns that these school kids have spent time and effort hand wrapping these gifts and they are just being tossed with no regard into a room, the security guard replied that I need not worry as they will need to open up everything to see what's inside. They laughed off my concerns and continued therefore i decided to film their actions as proof (sadly it doesn't allow me to upload videos on TripAdvisor). Later I discovered there was food inside the boxes which really made my stomach turn, this was known to everyone and yet they were throwing these on the floor. This food would then be distributed to other people, the members of this gurdwara really have no principles of Sikhism and again proved they are only doing this for the public eye.If that wasn't enough, as I looked above where I was sat there was a poster about their trip advisor rating, again validating my views. I am really disappointed with what I witnessed on my visit, only positive thing during this whole experience was the taxi driver who seemed like a genuine kind hearted person. I really hope the committee members embed the principles of Sikhism as if a non-Sikh witnessed what I did, it would leave a very sour taste in their mouth about Sikhi and would paint us all with the same brush.This is a very beautiful gurdwara inside and out, I just hope the people who run it also have a beautiful heart and treat this as a place of worship rather than for their own gain. My rating is based on what I witnessed on my visit from members of the gurdwara rather than the building itself.

Beautiful.. We wanted to go and see the gurdwara in all its glory and it's just beautiful. there is security on the front door and inside it's so peaceful, almost forget we're on holiday and felt like we're at home. A great job of building this gurdwara. It's beautiful.

Nice place for worship and contemplation. The Gurunanak Darbar Gurudwara is of relatively recent origin, which was constructed to address the requirement of the Sikh community of Dubai for a larger place of worhip than the existing one in Bur Dubai. This gurudwara is a short taxi or bus ride from the Ibn Battuta Mall and metro station.The gurudwara has a large prayer hall, with ardaas (devotional music) taking place regularly. One needs to cover one's head prior to entering. The congregation area downstairs, where langar was served, was extremely clean. The food too was tasty and filling. Do combine it with a visit to the aforementioned mall.
blessed. a place u can stop during ur trip in dubai to relax ur mind and feel God´s blessings and warm your heart
Beautiful temple ! . It is a beautiful Sikh temple Very quite and peaceful Langar is very good Parking is very easily available A must place to visit.
serene and peaceful. once you reach here you feel inner peace and very nice. I usually do not rate temples and religious places but this one is exception it gives inner peace

so good to see a Sikh temple in an Arab country. I'm Sikh, and I have visited many Gudwaras (Sikh Temples).This is a beautiful purpose built temple, however the outside does not have the traditional domed roof or the "Nishaan Sahib" (flag pole bearing the Sikh Flag), i'm assuming this is in line with local regulations... nevertheless it is still a fully functioning temple and serves as the pulsating heart of the Sikh and wider community.I have never seen such a well planned temple, right down to the seating for the ones who cannot sit on the floor, to the bespoke carpets and the circular ceiling.Friday is the weekend and the temple tends to be packed.*GETTING THERE AND BACK: you can take a taxi, or from the Ibn Battuta Metro station, the temple volunteers run a free minibus shuttle service to the temple and back on FRIDAYS ( this is very helpful, they mostly speak Punjabi, however you can always find an English speaker)
Beautiful. Beautiful peaceful place. Awesome Langar! must visit in Dubai, the meeting place of cultures.Feels like u are in punjab.
Stunning . This is a very beautiful Gurdwara and definitely worth a visit. A little further out so it might be worth asking your cab driver to wait for you.

Spiritual trip. This temple is situated at Jebel Ali. You can get there easily by Metro. Get down at Ibn Battutta Mall metro station and catch a cab or there is shuttle service. Apart from spiritual touch and beautiful interior decor,, what impressed me the most is their team work. The temple is open 24 hours serving unlimited free food to all. It is very crowded during weekends but still the place is well maintained, very neat and calm.
Wage guru!. Beautiful peaceful place. Awesome Langar! Loved the atmosphere and Gurbani. A must visit in Dubai, the meeting place of cultures

Visit. Easy way to get there is by the metro. You can get off at the energy station and wait for the car service provided by the Gurdwara sahib to be picked up and dropped back. Must visit when you are in Dubai.
Visit to the Gurunanak temple. the temple is far from Dubai. there is no sign board to locate the temple.But once your are there, you feel you are in one of the temple in India

peaceful and serenity. located around half an hour to forty minutes away from the main hussle and bussle of Dubai.
My wife's sister had a Sikh destination wedding in Dubai back in Feb 2016. The wedding ceremony was conducted at this Gurdwara and could not believe how calm and peaceful the ceremony was. I believe this was down to the surroundings.

Stunning. A beautiful experience and temple with such friendly people. The langar was exquisite, and the meditation was beautiful too.. Highly recommend to visit on a Friday where the prayer is continuous.

Great and Holy Place. Went there on a Saturday and was really charmed by the beauty of the exterior as well as the interior. It is a marvellous piece of architecture and we are very thankful to the Sheikh of Dubai to have made its construction possible.The Gurudwara is very close to several churches and gives a classic example of peaceful co-existance of the various religions.
Stunning. Absolutely stunning, peaceful and divine... We have visited the gudwara every time we have been to Dubai. It's beautiful and a must visit!

Great experience . I knew nothing about Sikh religion entering the temple. I knew quite a bit leaving it. Everyone is welcome and everyone is welcome to ask questions that would be answered. This land was given to Sikhs for free to build this temple, as several other churches / places of worship in the area. Everyone was very pleasant and hospitable, answering our questions and helping us to get our heads around the religion and the place.We were kindly offered a ride twice when leaving. The place has a free kitchen where you can eat anytime from morning till late. They are open every day.Very open, very helpful and hospitable. Thank you!!!

Beautiful, Grand and atmospheric. A Sikh temple is a place that welcomes one and all. It literally has 4 entrances to reinforce that all are welcome. It is a place for peace and reflection and calm. The location is about 30 mins from Dubai centre and not connected to the Metro so would recommend a Taxi. The langar was lovely and people seemed very friendly. There is information on the boards and a nice screen show in the entrance.

Undoubtedly the best place in Dubai.. You might have visited every attraction in Dubai, but your tour is incomplete without visit to Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple. A divine experience. Although everyone says that finding the transportation is difficult, but my travel agent (bookingsquad) arranged that for free.

GURUDWARA. A well built centrally airconditioned Sikh Gurudwara is a new attraction for Hindus. It is recently built and opened for worship papers. The langer is good and taken by thousand everyday and goes to 5000 on occasions. The Sikhs gives kar sewa . Enough parking place. Published c transport is difficult. The nearby metro is Jabeel Ali

a blessing.. you may have visited many Sikh temples all over the world .However this one is very special cause it is in UAE. SUPERB AMBIENCE lovely decor and instant spiritual connect. A must visit for people in and around UAE and ofcourse for tourists
Darbar at Dubai. Newly built Sikh temple. Great place to visit. It is in skirts. Getting conveyance is difficult. Little isolated and very few visitors.

Beautiful. Came here for a blessing as I went to Dubai for honeymoon.
Was quite hard to find, taxi man was even baffled when we asked him to take us there.
Not very busy.
Beautifully built but wish it was easier to get to instead of going down all the side streets.
Jo bole so nihal sat sri akal.. One of the best Gurdawara in the world. If you want to have peace and Blessings. just visit again and again.

Religious Retreat. This Gurudwara has been open since January 2012 and a big relief for Temple visitors in Dubai. Although it is a bit away from the Metro station, there are feeder buses to take you here, though infrequent. There is sufficient parking for cars.The place is very clean and there is a feeling of serenity as soon as one enters the Gurudwara.Listen to the Kiran or just sit in solitude and concentrate on the Almighty.

Moving experience . Great to see a development allowed for by the ruler of UAE.Folks remember trousers or 3/4 shorts for men.Also unlike UK gurdwaras you take your socks of alongside your shoes.Really calm feeling Gurdwara.
Feel great in Dubai. You will feel amazing and lot of peace . it is open for all and you will feel lot of peace and find sprituality in your self as you been to that place.
Divine experience. Away from Dubai's hustle-bustle, the Gurunanak Darbar is a divine and spiritual experience. Surely a must-see for people who believe in the religion.

Best place to visit in dubai.. One of the most serene places to visit while in dubai. The enrichment of the place is sure to get you attracted to this place and sikh community is anyways the most helping and courteous communities of the world.Make sure to visit this place. It has a beautiful structure too.

Such a peaceful. Was at this place when it was still under construction and was nice to return now all complete was really amazed with the architecture, looks so amazing such a peaceful place to gather your thoughts anyone wishing to visit regardless of your faith or religion all are welcomed with truly amazing people.
nice place. Worth to go this place... If you want to feel existence of your soul.. please go here in UAE. Also nice langar
a true gem. It has beautiful vibes, and a lovely interior. There is a divine feeling when you step right in! It is open to people of all faiths and they offer meals to everyone that visits

THIS IS A SIKH PLACE OF WORSHIP ! IT'S NOT A TOURIST ATTRACTION AND SHOULD NOT BE COMPARED TO ONE EITHER. I am dissapointed to see the poor reviews of ignorant people who think this Sikh Gurdwara is a tourist attraction. It is not, it is a holy place of worship for Sikhs . It's a beautiful serene gurdwara that is open to ALL . Its beautifully set out and the sewadars and security guard were so pleasent. We asked about why there is no Nishaan Sahib and were told it was not allowed by the Sheikh. I guess that is fair enough as Dubai is an ISLAMIC state. It is a way out to get there but its worth it it's truly beautiful.

Eternal Bliss!. A beautiful place of divinity and eternal bliss! Gurunanakji Darbar has its doors open always for all religions, caste and communities. The exteriors are done well , I liked the small step water fountains extended to the main door. As you enter, you are asked to remove shoes and cover your head as per the morals and beliefs of Sikhism. The staircase leads to the Guru Darbar on first floor where you are touched with serenity and peace. Your step on the soft lavender carpet spread meters wide leads you to the worship place that is well aired and lit with natural day light. Soft hymns sung live or recorded brings solace to your soul.Langar (vegan meal) is served during all times of day on ground floor, worshipers have their meals and even contribute their service for distributing Langar. Place is clean, hygienic and very systematically organized. Dining table is set in corners for those who find it difficult to sit on ground. Even though it’s located in JebelAli, I always find a reason to revisit it frequently. Everyone must go!

You could be in India. I was very pleasantly surprised to see this beautiful temple, tranquil during the week but very busy at weekends. The setting is peaceful and tranquil. Brought tears to our eyes being in a gurdwara in Dubai, truly lovely experience

Peace & calm. Visiting the darbar is so soothing and a peaceful experience. Though located in Jebel Ali, far away from heart of Dubai is a place to visit. Can get crowded on public holidays, but the crowds are in no way unpleasant.

Peace Calm Love Friendliness Spiritual Vibrations. I have been to the Darbar on many occasions and on each occasion I found the volunteers very helpful, humble and friendly.The atmosphere is very soothing and full of spiritual vibrations. The spiritual meal that is distributed is very healthy, nutritious and tasty. Overall, a place where one is pulled to go back again and again.
Beautiful. The place is really peaceful & beautiful .Langar is served which is surprisingly great .its a must visit for sure

Spiritual Meditation. Beautiful architecture with quiet surroundings leaves you at peace when you visit the temple. It's the perfect place to meditate and pray. You can also view the spirit of service when you head down to have your meal which is prepared for thousands of people in the temple.The location is in Jebal Ali and can be reached by taxi from the Jebal Ali Metro Station.

Lovely architecture and peace place of worship. The gurunanak Sikh temple was mesmerising and has great architecteture. It's actually really nice and although it is placed a little away from public transport, taxis can take your there.My first attempt to visit was not successful as we really could not locate, so we went back to Dubai and the mission was to visit this temple. The best thing to do is either get the metro to IBN Buttatta mall and then ask a taxi driver to take you or a taxi from your hotel. I'd recommend the metro route as a lot to f drivers still do not kno about the template.The other main problem is there are not any cabs near by so it's best to ask the driver to wait for you, I have heard that on Fridays the temple is busier than usual and cabs are more frequent but transportation is also provided.You really couldn't walk here from IB but having said that regardless of the missions I did to visit, I'd definitely go again. Oh, and for those of you who haven't been to a Sikh temple, there is always langur provided' a blessed meal and i''d highly recommend having this. The people here were also very friendly and made us feel right at home.

Peaceful place. Visited Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple several times and without fail every time its a soothing and peaceful experience. spirit of service and piety pervades everywhere. Great relief from the stress of Dubai life

Such a relaxing welcoming place. We walked into the temple and we were immediately welcomed by members of the community and told to walk around freely and have a look, they provide head scarfs for both genders and are so welcoming. A few people came up and asked if we were OK and has any questions as we probably did look a little lost on there! Such a calming atmosphere in the temple, we were offered food and drinks. As a resident of Dubai for almost 10years I had no idea it existed, I will visit again

Culture trip in Dubai. Really nice building, great little tour and nice food too. Worth the trip out. Prayer room is wonderfully day lit and the side rooms with scriptures being used was nice to have the explanation of what and why from one of the helpers. The scriptures in the main room and it surround is stunning.

Mesmerizing, exquisite, amazing!. You can spend every weekend here, with the calming sounds in and around the Gurudwara. I love the display of lyrics of the soothing songs to the almighty and the Guru. A treat to the eyes would be to watch the GuruGranth Saheb being put to bed. Very welcoming for Sikhs and non Sikhs alike, I also love the food as it is like no other!

A must visit. I think this place is definitely a must to visit. Very we'll maintained, it is an excellent religious place which is also a touristic place. Beautiful decor. Serene atmosphere. Excellent n very tasty langer (food) is served in a very hygienic way.

Spiritual & Peach of place. I have never visit gurudwara in India but now visited often in dubai, best thing that just not for Sikhs but open to anyone of any religion..what a beautiful place to visit.Very welcoming atmosphere. And the Langar was amazing.Highly recommend the visit

Begining of our new year with darshan. We visited the temple to begin our year with the blessings of waheguru on the very 1st of January. its a recently built gurudwara little on outskirts of Dubai (I think)... its huge and beautiful. it was very well lit up and we also had langar in their big langar hall. there were buses with people visiting the gurudwara as its no less then a monument

Gurunanank Darbar Gurdwara/ Sikh Temple. Place of worship for all regardless as instructed by divine teachings of Guru Nanak, Founder.Beautiful, peaceful and charming to the eyes. Following worship, enjoy food [Langer]together as one family. Great decision Dubai to grant permission Thanks. x

Amazing . We have travelled to the UAE many times but didn't even know about the sikh temple....Not just for Sikhs but open to anyone of any religion..what a beautiful place to visit.Very welcoming atmosphere. And the Langar was amazing (vegetarian meal). Highly recommend the visit

The Most modern Gurudwara. Thanks to the Sheikh of Dubai upon request of the Sikh Communities who live in Dubai and from around the world The Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Tample became an iconic pilgrimage destination for all Sikhs. The architect is one of the most beautiful. A must visit place for all Dubai visitors.
Peace of mind. This is prestigious site just like golden temple in Amritsar.we r proud tht in Muslim country our rulers hv allowed us to built such beautiful worship place.we r thankful to ur rulers.
Peace . Excellent ambience, service always the best, place of calm and peace! We go back almost every month and it's a must visit!

Very Spiritual. I am not a Sikh but we had heard such a lot about the new Gurdwara that our entire family went for a visit. It is accessible by bus and metro and close to the Ibn Batuta Mall. Away from home its a tranquil haven for connecting with the almighty and spending some time away from the hectic work life. Commendable job done by the committee members and the Local Sikh community to maintain the grandeur of the place and the langar and seva offered.You must have the Langar there. A visit surely inculcates humility and care and compassion for fellow human beings. .
Relaxing. Beautiful place. Calm and relaxing specially during the day.Can sit for hours an relax. Don't miss Langar prasad.

Calming experience !. It was so nice to visit a Gurudwara in Dubai, never really imagined going to one until my aunt took us there. The fragrance of the flowers in the streets leading up to the stairs for the Gurudwara and to the soothing chants playing inside, the whole experience was so calming. Though I regret not being there for the early morning prayer due to an early flight. We went at around 9 - ish in the night and even at that time there were so many people in there and there is also a small Shiv temple on the floor below the Gurudwara. It was like I was back in India !
Totally amazing!!. This made our holiday to Dubai very memorable. Amazing Gardwara, very clean, and very helpful staff. We felt at peace, a truly amazing experience.

Peaceful and serene. Peaceful and serene. Take the Metro to Energy Station. There is shuttle on Friday evenings from the metro station to Guru Nanak Darbar Sahib. or take the Metro to IBN Batuta, take bus number 44. It is about 10 minutes walk from the bus stop to Guru Nanak Darbar.
A must visit for all sikhs visiting Dubai. This is the only gurdwara in Dubai so take a visit. Use the metro system and take a taxi from there for a couple of pounds.

Must Visit. The Gurunanak Darbar- Sikh temple is about 40 min away from Dubai . You can connect on the Metro and than use the feeder bus or if a group of people please call the Gurudwara and they will arrange the free pick up shuttle. Its a unique Sikh temple with a big dome which is made without pillars. Langar is served thru out the day for the devotees, Its open to all religion nationalities, dress up appropriately while visiting , else you can borrow when you reach the temple .

Religiously peaceful. Too good temple to have some nice, calm, silent and peaceful time. construction is huge and amazing considering low sikh population there, but still its a 10 out of 10 attraction.

Serenity..... Gurudwara is kept so neat and clean. It is like a blessing to be there and feel eternal peace. Everyone there is so down to earth and ready to serve with a smile at lungar. Morning and evening Gurbani is so peaceful and heart touching.
Best Gurudwara in Dubai. Visited twice felt that i am in heaven.very clean we eat lunger also which was so tasty visit there again

Amazing place . Best place to visit and find peace. Very friendly people. Busiest times are Friday's and Saturday's.
Love coming here every time I come to Dubai!

An really clam and tranquil place. Great to see different religions that are represented in this country.
The sikh temple is a beautiful place.

Peaceful . I am not Sikh. However, I do like to visit different religious buildings when I am in other countries. I think it is to see how they express love and respect for their religions but also because they tend to be some the most beautiful in the country. It was spacious and peaceful. Parking was easy as it was just across the road. Although it was a very windy day and so we were being pelted with sand as it was a little off the beaten path. Then we entered and all that stuff outside was a thing of the past. There was white marble, purple carpets and drapes, geometric patterns in the ceiling of the pray hall and so on. If you like to visit religious buildings in your spare time then give it a try. The people that met us were friendly and hospitable.

Wahe Guru ji da khalsa. This is a religious place for Sikh community however Gurudwara is open for everyone for darshan, satsang and prasad. If you are a Indian in Dubai, this is a must visit for your internal peace. Please note that your head should be covered all time when you are in premises, picture not allowed.Opening time: Plz refer their websiteParking: AvailablePrasad: For everyone

ONE WORD - BEAUTIFUL. Peace is what you will get here apart from seeing the lovely architecture and variety of Prasads. The area near the Gurdwara might be barren but it is a must visit if you are in Dubai.

Peaceful place to visit. Although this Sikh Temple (Gurdwara) is outside of the main city area of Dubai it is definitely worth visiting. We took a cab out to the location on a Friday evening and we were fortunate to find a free shuttle back to our hotel, but it can be tricky in finding taxis in the area. The Gurdwara is absolutely stunning and is very tranquil, and don't leave without eating some prashaad! Hope you all enjoy your visit too! :)

Amazing. Always have a calming, wonderful experience! Best to go in weekdays. Quiet and very calming place to pray and meditate. Food is offered free during meal time. Ample parking space is available around the Darbar. People are very courteous and guide you well when to cover your heads and enter or where to drop your shoes.

Arena Of Peace and tranquility. We visited the temple on an early Friday morning while the Asa Di Var was being recited, The congregation at the Gurdwara recited the Gurbani along with the help of two large screens. The place is well designed with ample space for devotees for the prayers, langar, community services and the car park.The surrounding area is quite developed since my last visit in 2015.Definitely in the itenary for every visit to the UAE,

Grace and peace, amidst the city of towering heights. I've been a Gurdwara girl since childhood, so entering the Darbar in Jebel Ali was going back to the centre for me. But even for non-hindus, if you're open to a view of the Sikh gurus and the experience of a langar, do walk in. It's a large beautiful space. Meditate in a corner, or just listen to the kirtan (devotional singing). And don't leave without eating- if not the langar (food from the communal free kitchen), then do have prasad. There's a purity in this food that comes from a dollop of devotion and love when cooking.

Do Not Walk From The Energy Metro Station!. Do Not Walk From the Metro Station because it is a walk through a barren desert. Our experience at the Sikh temple was much different than I expected but it was still amazing. We are visiting from the USA and I expected an ornate temple but it was more simple than I expected especially after seeing the Grand Mosque in Abu Dhabi. What was really cool is the people there were actually participating in their religion and you had the chance to see it in action. The director saw us confused and explained to us what was going on. They also have a free buffet style meal for everyone who comes in. No questions asked! Definitely an amazing cultural experience if you love learning.
Very nice Sikh temple. All religious places are good though. This one is also one of the best built and should be visited frequently.
Good temple for Hindus. Good temple to visit for hindus.Good location of templeGood variety of prasad available at templeGood place to visit with family
Amazing Building. Long way from Downtown but an amazing new building which is very clean and modern. The area around needs sorting out as it is quite barren
A must Visit. A must visit in Dubai ! Very peaceful and beautiful ! Great architecture, and strongly recommended !

Beautiful Gurdwara ... must Visit !. If you are in Dubai you must visit this beautiful place of worship located near Ibn Battuta mall.You truly feel the peace in your mind when you reach this place.Always filled with devotees from morning till 8:30pm .There are 2 projectors that display / translate the mantras in different languages.Make sure to have langer which is served to all devotees throughout day till 9:00pm. Two levels of parking available at the basement of Gurudwara.If you're going by red line of Dubai metro get off at Ibn Battuta mall and take a taxi. Gurudwara has a Bus Shuttle Service to the nearest Metro Station too.I would highly recommend a visit to this Gurudwara except Fridays as its very crowded throughout that day.

Beautiful Sikh Temple. We took a cab from Atlantis hotel to the Jebel Ali area to visit this Gurdwara (Sikh temple). My dad has visited a few times so he was already aware that taxi's are difficult to find for the return journey so we asked the taxi driver to wait for us which he kindly did. Of course the meter was still running but this was not an issue for us and the cost was really not big. The journey from my hotel to Jebel Ali and a 30 minute running meter was around 50 something dirhams, obviously this doesn't include the return journey to hotel.The Gurdwara itself is beautiful and peaceful, your head must be covered and shoes removed and placed in the area provided. The main prayer hall is upstairs and a lift is available if required.You must not leave without trying the 'Prashad' this is like a sacred pudding and is always delicious!!

Definitely worth a visit. Great architecture, providing a peaceful, spiritual sanctuary. I'd strongly recommend to Sikhs and non-Sikhs alike. Ask someone local to tell you the best days to visit. If you want to really learn and get to better understand Sikhism, this is a great place to do so. Very peaceful, very spiritual and welcoming to all visitors. Non-Sikhs, to make the most of your visit, please ask someone about dress code ahead of visiting.

Justifably up there with the things to do!. This Sikh Temple in the middle of nowhere is awe inspiring. The people are very friendly. It's best to go between 6-8 pm to enjoy some of the music. We had issues finding a taxi back but the security guards made sure one of the locals would drop us off to the nearest station - a warm community feel about the place. tip: be sure to have some 'langar' - food for the public, open to everyone as a symbol of the sikh relioin.

Very interesting. Beautiful decor inside the building. Mostly very busy. Free meals offered and is a must try (I feel) to complete the experience.Loved sitting inside the upper floor and listening to "Chanting, singing and drumbeats", felt very calm and spiritual.Be modestly dressed and respectful when visiting.

Wow amazing . Gurdwara in Dubai is so beautiful. Me and my wife went on a Friday. I would recommend if travelling to gurdwara make sure your driver waits around for you as there are no taxi nearby. The experience was amazing.
wahe guru ji ki jai. Beautiful temple in middle east country located in dubai jebel ali area. nice and clam place for all hindu.

Great !. If you want to see great gurdawara in Middle East - this is the place to visit. As you will get free vegetarian meal with chai- Indian tea latte style and you can meditate there as well. If you are taking metro-train, it is about 20 min walk from station to gurdawara. The good part is that they have complimentary shuttle service to and from train station. We didn't take the shuttle and walked with the kids which was an adventure itself.
Tranquility in a city of madness. my second visit to this fantastic Gurdwara. Great hospitality and still kept up in good condition.. well done to all.

Lovely Sikh temple. Outside it looks like a normal building but inside it is very beaautiful. Please be respectful. Men and women need to cover their heads and leave shoes outside but they have scarves available to wear in case you didn't have one. They serve lunch during langar. They accept donations.

Beautiful. A must visit.. On our 19th visit to this beautiful country, we had still not gone to mathadekho at the gurudwara. It was in a rather remote place, but such as hidden gem. Parking was great, very close vicinity to the metro station, and with a spectacular architecture. Our family and i had been meaning to go to this gurudwara for ages, and we regret having discover

Amazing temple. It has to be one of the best temples I have visited. From the outside the building looks pretty normal, but once you step inside you instantly know you're in a Sikh temple. Very clean and organised. I am sure I will go there again.
worth a visit. took a day out from our 3 visit to abu dhabi to visit the gurdwara. so glad that we didtruly peaceful and inspiring visit.

So glad I visited!. I'm so glad I visited the gurdwara during our stay in Dubai. Friends and family had said to visit the gurdwara during our trip. We had to ask 3 different taxi drivers to take us there as no one knew where it was located! Finally our 3rd taxi driver knew where it was...its a 30mins taxi ride from Dubai mall...past Dubai marina as if you're travelling south and out of Dubai. It's located in a residential area. We spent a couple of hours at the gurdwara and like I mentioned - I'm so glad we came. The feeling of visiting any gurdwara is always spiritual and a blessing. We did have a problem with flagging down a taxi to return to our hotel. The security guard at the gurdwara arranged for someone to drop us off to the nearest taxi point. Yes I felt awkward however it took me back to the days where people did things out of the goodness of their hearts. The person who dropped us off ended up being from the same city as my parents back in Punjab anyway! Definitely worth a visit!
The Finest Gurudwara. This is by far one of the best Gurudwara in terms of architecture, it really is as grand as Dubai, truly a bliss, dont miss the Langar

Peaceful. A very peaceful and inspiring visit. We visited the Gurudwara on Saturday afternoon. After visiting the main praying hall, we were served a simple tasty meal in the hall downstairs. This meal is called langar and is served free of any cost. There is a box in case we want to make a donation towards the cost but nothing compulsory. Only requirement is to dress up decently, fully covered. Heads have to be covered with a scarf as a mark of respect.
Breath taking. Very nice Gurudhwra. Close to Ibn Al Batuta mall. Very well designed. Langar is also served regularly.
lovely. Cultural, even if you are not a sikh well worth a visit it looksa faboulous and it is...... But cover your head!

Peaceful & Sewa oriented. The Gurudwara is like any other I have been to peaceful, sewa oriented & fulfilling. The place is a lil distance away from the metro stations & the cabbies a reluctant to go to & take you back to metro stations from this place as they get stuck in traffic. But gurudwara committee found a solution for this by starting a shuttle between Energy metro station & temple. Once inside you are take over by the beauty of this place. The Darshan & prayer offerings is very peaceful and there is no rush. All the devotees pay respect to each other. After the prayer the Karah prasad is offered and is as tasty as always & so is the langar that everyone accepts as prasad. They also have arrangements of tea & snacks post lunch for anyone who wants to have some. Alteast when we went they offered us. There is an BOB ATM for the convenience of the visitors as well. Overall the sewa ki bhawna that is the main focus in any Gurudwara is very evident at this place.Felt blessed.

just a short ride from Dubai Airport.... a wonderful Gurudwara .. Dhan, Dhan, Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji. If you are flying over to India... a stop in at this new Gurudwara is a must.... we spend a day year... and l come to know of it when it was being build... and my wish was to visit it... a big thank you to the Sheikh of Dubai... cuts all ties of what people think of Muslims cuts all barriers .... what a lovely sikh community that lives in Dubai.....

Heaven on Earth. This peaceful Gurudwara is located in Jebal Ali. It is huge and has difference prayer rooms. It is so peaceful and serene. There is food being served all day here for people who come to visit.

Inner Peace. No Words can Describe the Feeling once inside the Gurudwaara...As a Relegious Place, Every Shrine in the World has Some Kind of Positive Energy or Inner Peace within it, The Secoond Gurudwaara in Dubai UAE after the old one in Dubai Abra, To Every Traveler in Dubai its a Must Visit to the Gurudwaara...Located Near Jabal Ali...Taxi Available from Ibn Batuta Metro Station on the Red Line of Dubai Metro...As Its far and on a remote place...commuters usually have a private car or a tourist bus...Taxis Can be Called for Returning from the Place to the Nearest Metro Station the Gurudwaara has a Bus Shutte Service to the Nearest Metrro Station Station in the Evenings..Prayers start from Early in the Morning according to the timings of Shri Harmandir Saheb also known as the Golden Temple,,,afer the prayers have been offered they serve langar known as food with Dal Roti Rice and a Sabzi Depends on the Timings...The Darbar on the First Floor has the Shrine with the HOLY BOOK known as GRANTHSAHIB...Whch is Being Read by the Sikh Priests Always..Along with a Special Place for the GRANTHSAHIB to be Kept every Day...U Can Also Do Sewa or Volunteer for the Food in Serving or Distributin...All Facilities as Services Available There Except Wifi...Seatings for Senior Citizens Etc....No More words to Express About any Religious Place Its Just One Thing GO VISIT YOURSELF and From the Begening to the End '' JOH BOLE SOHNI HAAL - SAT SRI AKAL''
Simply Beautiful. The only gudwara in Dubai. Its really beautiful, very well maintained. Its really huge and remarkable. The feeling in the gudwara is simply awesome...

Oasis of peace. There are no words that can describe the feeling you get when you are there... go around 7.30 in the evening for the evening prayers.. They will definitely take your breath away.. the "keertan" or the songs that they sing are so melodious that your entire day's tiredness would just vanish...

Only Gurudwara in Dubai. This only Gurudwara in Dubai. It was just 3-4 km away from our Hotel in Dubai Marina. Visited this holy place between 10.30 a.m. to 12.00 p.m., heard Guruvani and then participate in Lungar.. The menu was so ice and hygienic. There was a a marriage function also at our visit time. There are limited option for temples and gurudwara in Dubai. You can visit this one if you have faith and spare time. However this place is inside from road and whole area is some lonely with various religion places including churches. So you have to wait for taxi or come out on main road.

Holy place - a source of inspiration for many. I have made a point to visit this holy place whenever I am in dubai. Accordingly i went there and noticed there is no change. Everything is same. The place has very encouraging environment , very neat and clean rather it is now visited by many more visitors, well disciplined and with devotion. Every one enjoys Prasad at lunger. Many people volunteered for services in good section preparing and serving devotees even many offer karseva by polishing shoes at this holy place.its very encouraging and motivating place giving assurance and consolation to devotees. It's a must and worth a visit
Fabulous temple. Special temple, worth taking a trip to see, it is beautiful surroundings, you can feel the serene atmosphere this has and the beauty of the temple.

As a Sikh its nice 2 feel at home in the middle east. Everyone is welcome & help yourself 2 a nice warm cup of India tea. Lovely building and everyone is welcome to go in for a nice cup of warm indian tea! Nice holy place for all believers in God to visit :-)

A beautiful Gurudwara, one of the best after the Golden Temple. The Gurunanak Darbar Dubai opened in Dubai in early 2012 and is a beautiful Gurudwara welcoming all worshipers. It opends at 4.30 am and is open till 9.30pm daily without closure during the day. When you enter there is a small hall where you can keep your footwear and right next to it there are wash basins to wash your hands. On the right is the hall where langar is served all day- Langar is food that is offered to all worshipers free of charge. This food is considered as God's offering to us. On the first floor is the prayer room which is huge and has separate sitting areas for men, women and families. The usual practice one follows when visiting is first you remove your shoes, wash your hands, cover your head with a safa or scarf and then head to the first floor to offer prayers. On exiting the prayer room you are offered prasad/ halwa after which you come down to the ground floor for langar. It is an extremely peaceful place and one gets peace of mind when visiting this pious place.

"A Holy Place in Dubai". Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple is a peaceful and beautiful place in Dubai. This is a great meditation place. A holy place for prayer. Devotee also served with Langaar. This place is ISO certified and really a must visit place.

Superb Sikh Temple. Visited this Sikh temple for the first time. Quite an amazing place.Very majestic architecture. On fridays over 10,000 throng this Temple. 'Langar' free lunch is served to all devotees who sit on the ground without any separation from caste , creed or social status and is considered a divine food from the Gods.All funding is through charitable voluntary donations.A must visit to people of all religions.You will feel blessed.
Peaceful. This was my first visit to a Gurudwara and I really enjoyed it. Went on a weekday and it was very pleasant. Heard it gets very busy on weekends.

Amazing Place, Get Peace of soul. Dear Friends,Must go to this place, I am not sure but what I have heared that king of Dubai & UAE Believe land of UAE belong to muslims no other religions will get land to make mandir, gurudwara, crurch, only muslims mosque are made on Earth. Even you visit Burdubai Madir olders mandir ( Single Mandir ) in UAE but it was made on first floor, gurdwara above it on second floor.So once you visit this place, you will feel you are in india, Hard to get public conveyence Close to Energy Metro station/Iban Batuta Metro station, But its worth than any place in Dubai.Langer is going on whole day...

Beautiful Gurudwara. We visited this beautiful Gurudwara in dec 2015 while we were in Dubai for our vacations. Gurudwara is far from city and if you go by taxi it will cost you a lot, but when you reach there it is worth spending the buck.
Excellent environment in the mid of dessert. Its amazing to visit this Gurudwara specially at night and the LUNGER is amazingly yummy must visit place if you are travelling from India.

Wonderful Temple. The best Sikh temple I have ever seen. 1000 times better than Golden Temple. Beautifully built, certified by intertek to many international standards. We were awed by its quality in every way. A must see place.
Peaceful. I love going to the Gurudwara and just sitting there and listening to the Kirtans - its very peaceful, and the interiors of the Gurudwara are beautiful!

Peaceful . What a difference in noise levels from the city centre.
You could hear a pin drop.
So peaceful and tranquil I felt an air of calmness around me.
Such a wonderful place to visit and a chance to view and respect other cultures.

Very tranquil and beautiful. It was a lovely experience, the Gurudwara was very beautiful, tranquil and clean. The Guru's Kirtans were on throughout the day. The langar was also served practically all day.
It was a special for us to visit the Gurudwara during our trip. Definitely a highlight of our trip... specially if you enjoy the holy Granth Sab.

Tranquillity and contentment. It is truly amazing to see the Gurunanak temple in Dubai and experience the serenity that it offers. After removing footwear and washing the feet, devotees are offered cloth to cover their heads and enter the prayer hall which is quite majestic and immediately provides a feeling of calmness.After offering prayers, devotees are offered nutritious food for free and it is truly moving to see the dedication and service of the people providing delicious food. From what we heard, the food is prepared and served voluntarily by devotees.This is one of the places that wont be featured in a tourist guide, but after a long day of sightseeing, it provides the perfect relaxation for both body and mind
Spiritual & Pious. This is a very sacred and holy place known for its sanctity.They also serve food for free during prayer time and believe in total humanity.
Beautiful Gurudarbar. Loved the atmosphere, It was so soothing and nice to be at this place. Its far from city but devotees should visit this place

The only Gurdwara in Middle East. This is primarily a place of worship for Sikhs, the only Gurudwara in the middle-east. If you are an Indian and/or a Sikh you must visit this Gurudwara just for the significance of the place and for the fact that it has come up as a symbol of intra-faith co-existence which is rare in other parts of the Arab world. Many Sikhs would be surprised that the Sikh symbolic flag - Nishan Sahib - does not flutter outside the building as is the norm elsewhere in the world. The place is serene and quite, a rare place of quiet in fast and noisy Dubai. Also, the central hall is magnificent and beautiful. Worth a visit.
Very peaceful like all Gurudarbars. Well maintained and well managed. Peaceful place like all darbars. Parking is an issue on holidays but you can find it within the area.
Awesome !!. Touching place and awesome feeling after visiting darbar sahib @ Dubai...Not enough words..wahe guru !!

One of the best Gurudwaras. Every Gurudwara is good, but this one has some uniqueness, not only the way it is designed but also how it is operated. Very impressed, on how professionally it is managed and operated. ISO certified. Way to go. Striving to set higher standards.

Superb. Unbelievable! I happened to visit this temple at December 15 at Dubai. Amazing, such a beautiful temple is built in Dubai. It is the outskirts of Dubai. If you at Dubai and finished visiting out important and main attractions, you can surely make some time to visit this place. Worth the effort. They serve food also at the temple.
Among World Bigest Gurudwaras. Very good place .Visited on 25.12.2015 Friday, Enjoyed Weekly special kirtan programme & get langer(Free Kitchen).

Waheguru. A beautiful, tranquil, peaceful and welcoming Sikh Temple. Like all Sikh temples, very welcoming offer guru ka langar (food), all fresh and hot. A small exhibition of ornaments given to the darbar sahib.

Serene and calm place...... away from the hustle and bustle of the city....... A true reflection of the cultural and religious heritage of UAE, where all religions are treated equal..... the place is beautifully made and gives the serene and peaceful feeling one longs for......watching the people serve selflessly and their ever welcoming nature while serving "langar" is humbling..... It brings you back everytime..... again and again......however, it is best to visit if you have own transportation, since it is a bit away from the main road.

Worth visiting. Peaceful place to offer prayers or just meditate. Walkable from the metro or you can take a bus (not very frequent and you still have to walk a bit) or taxi (not easily available). Friendly staff and they serve langar (food) too. Need to cover your head before you enter the prayer hall.
A Memorable Place to Visit. It was a memorable visit to the worlds ISO certified Gurudwara, Gurunank Darbar Dubai and a great experience having Langar there.

Ok but a few points to note before you go. Nice temple but note:- Awkward remote location, can get a taxi there but no taxis around when leaving.. Either note the local taxi company phone number to order a taxi, Uber one or walk down the road and take a left for the nearest train station which is called Energy and around a 15 min walk.- Cant help in the kitchens etc which is one of the things I like about Sikh Temples so that was a little disappointing but the food was delicious and the people are lovely and very generous.- We were told off a little bit for sitting at the tables and chairs and told to sit on the floor despite being with my inlaws who are in their 60's... Not sure how old you have tolook to qualify for the seating which was empty..- Was quiet when we arrived at 11am and busy at lunch so keep in mind. Would go again but not the best temple I've been to.

VERY SERENE & TRANQUIL DEVOTIONAL PLACE. As the title suggests, this GuruDwara in Jebel Ali, Dubai brings peace to the mind and soul... Soft humming in Gurumukhi resonating in the high ceiling creates a very peaceful atmosphere. As mandatory for all gurudwaras, this religious place offers FREE food to all devotees who enter the temple.
The architecture of the place is distinctive and impressive.
excellent place. if you are in Dubai must visit there. Amazing place and surely you feel relax once you enter in this holy place.
Visit to Guru Nanak Darbar. Brilliant experience, people working there were all volunteers, very friendly and very knowledgable.

Purely Spiritual. With the kind donation of land from the King of Dubai to the Sikh community, they have been able to build a beautiful Gurudwara - Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple.The utmost respect and equality this temple demands on all faiths is very humbling.The temple is purely beautiful, you stop in your tracks when entering the darbar sahib where the guru granth sahib is beautifully placed. There is a friendly atmosphere within the congregation (of all faiths) and lungar is served for those who visit.Friday is the main day of worship and you'll find 10,000 worshipers enter the temple and have lungar before they leave. If you are using the metro to visit the Gurudwara on a Friday, I recommend you get off at station 'Energy', outside the station the Gurudwara staff offer free transportation to and from the Gurdwara until 9pm. Any other day I recommend you get off at station IBN Batutta and get a taxi from outside the station. Definitely recommend you visit.
Beautiful place beautiful people. Peaceful and friendly atmosphere. It is a place of worship so please be respectful. They have homely langar and prasad. Sikhs are as always very welcoming here.

Spiritual Temple. After the visit to the Golden temple in Amritsar we were interested to revsit the Sikh temple (Gurudwala) in Dubai. Situated just after IBN Battuta mall, the temple is a nice place to resource oneself spiritually. After listening to a nice chanting prayer we went to bow to the Gurusahib- the Sacred book and then went to the main hall for the Langar- Typical Indian meal.All was very nice. On the way back stop over to IBN Battuta Mall which depicts the adventure and exploration of a valliant Sailor. Different Themes of the Mall- Andalousia,Tunisia, Egypt(the Astronomy themes),Persia,China(photo with the wrecked ship), India(photo with the Elephant). Nice combination of shopping, Culture and food.

The moment of Convergence of Divinity and eating together with Humans. The place is a divine Confluence of the Non religious Divinity spell bound with some sort of aura thats hitting directly to ones soul when converging with the divine sight and sounds of the atmosphere that prevails within this building.One of the simplistic toursist destination open to all relgions, all caste and enlightening in ones soul the spirit of one human one god one soul and no barriers.The sight of people worshipping the universe. the worshipping each other by serving food to masses is a sight f care compassion and love unconditional.the best part is food as HOT and FRESH is served vegetarian to the masses where all sit togetherin 200 - 500 at a time being served unlimited to satiate hunger and as well as to remark a sign of all are equal in eyes of lord. Thats the divine prasad or divine food.the only olace where yu see rich and pooor confluence together. the caste and castelss confluence to gether. all have a same meal. all sit together eat pray and rejoice. one of the places sure to visit and pay ones tribute to the humanity and respect to the Humanity in form of Unconditional unbiased Love.

Good to visit. Beatiful temple with easy access in jabel ali area.Ample parking space and easy to locate this temple.Like in India professional guidance inside temple.You must sit and offer prayer of choice of your time.Free food also served for devotees in a big hall

Peaceful. I feel very peaceful in my every visit. Big hall and prayers all the time.Service is excellent with 7 stars.Food is offered all the time to the visitors with no limits.I was touched looking at the volunteers at the shoe rack stand, they will take your shoes, they will clean it and will return them with their hands. Applause !!!

Peace.....just peace. had a lovely time visiting the Gurudwara. Was filled with immense peace and joy. THe place is amazing. Do spend quality time here and pray for your loved ones. THe prasad is amazing. they have 24 hour round the click langar seva. All seekers are blessed and served hot food with tea. Many visitors choose not to come here, but that's a mistake they make. Travel by metro to Iben Batuta and tale a taxi to gurudwara. DO VISITBe blessedCheersSandeep Jain
Amazing experience!. Beautiful temple, well maintained and clean. They offer very nice Langar on fridays to all. Was a beautiful experience. People

Magnificient Gurdwara in Dubai. We visited the Gurudwara on a Friday. The place is maintained very well and extremely disciplined and organised. The main shrine is so peaceful. Langaar is served for those who wish to partake in it.
peaceful. thanks to the Government of UAE for allowing Indian expatriates to built a temple in Dubai. very well made and maintained by the community here in Dubai.

Clean and Peaceful.. This place of worship is so clean.It is ideal for worship and focus.You can eat from the kitchen downstairs and know the food is prepared with love.It is simple food but tasty.I spent 1.5hrs there,it was worth it!
Mesmerizing place. A beautiful gurudwara on way to Abu Dabhi in Jebel Ali village, a little far from the main town but a must visit

So Beautiful and Calm. Its about 2km from Ibn Battuta Gate Mall. A taxi ride would cost you about 10aed... you might want to ask ur taxi to wait for you as not easy to flag down a taxi.. however we were lucky... walking down to road less than 5mins we had a cab coming.. :) The Gurdwara is big with a spacious darbar sahib and langar hall.. its simply beautiful.. i love it. the langgar (free food) is available for anyone and everyone... A must visit when you are in Dubai...

Awesome Gurudwara in the Outskirts of Dubai. One of the finest Gurudwara I have seen in my International travel.A big / iconic Gurudwara in Arabian world with ample parking space, langar hall at the entrance and Prayer room at the first floor.Prayer room is attached with the meditation room and a finest relaxing place with the vibes of Guru Granth Sahib.SATNAM SHRI WAHEGURU JI !!Note : Does have a metro station nearby 1 km.

Lovely, but no taxi's!. We went to see the gurdwara and got a taxi from dubai marina. It took 15-20 minutes to get there, and we were warned before hand to keep hold of our taxi as there are no taxi's in the area. And we're glad we did.....as not sure where or how we would have got back! Lovely prayer hall inside, seen it on TV previously, a must visit for the Sikh community. Top tip: Ask your cab driver to wait!!

Absolutely Beautiful!. I visit this Sikh Temple at least once every year I visit Dubai and it is well worth the visit. The architecture is amazing and the people here are very open and friendly to people of all faiths. I'm a Sikh, but brought along an African American friend on my visit and she enjoyed visiting the temple as well.

Stunning, Peaceful and a must visit for all when in Dubai. What a beautiful and serene place. You walk through the doors and the volunteers welcome is the start of the excellent visit. You do not have to be a Sikh to visit, all are welcome. Upon entering remove shoes and cover head (provided for all). Walk upstairs to the main temple hall, sit, relax and take in the peaceful energy of the service. We were in a rush so could not stay for communal langar (free meal) served to all that visit. They have a website which you can see the times the temple is open. Suggest you arrange for taxi to wait for you or arrange transport prior to pick you up. As you will need to walk to main road to flag a taxi. Not to easy in evening when your with young children and it's hot outside :-). As I said, this is a gem of a place and a definitely must for all to visit when in Dubai.

Beautiful. About 10 mins from the Marina area (in Jebel Ali), this is a lovely Gurdwara with an interesting internal layout. If you take a taxi to get there then I would suggest asking the driver to hang around if you do not intend to stay too long. There not much else in the vicinity so catching a taxi may prove difficult.

Beautiful!. A must see, beautiful architecture and such a peaceful place of worship. People from all walks of life toured the Sikh Temple but just make sure you have something to cover your head when you go. It's a bit of a way out of Dubai, but very close to Jabel Ali metro station which can be a more comfortable and faster trip! It's gorgeous and definitely worth the trip, it will be part of my regular visits in the future. ps: As goes with any place of worship, it would only help to do a quick wiki search on the religion so as to be respectful once going in.

Lovely.. So amazing and beautiful inside. Only issue i had was getting a Taxi after the visit. Couldnt find a Taxi anywhere so i we had to walk around to the main road for 15mins. As far as i was told, Not many taxi come to collect passengers in this area. I would advised booking a private taxi.
One of the Best Gurudwara outside India. Very Beautiful, clean , Hygienic & Peaceful place to worship. Kirtan and the Langar just increase the value by a million times to this eternal place.

An Excellant Devotional Place. if you are a Hindu/Sikh don't forget to visit Gurunanak Darbar at Jebel Ai Village. Very good community service and a very peaceful area. I am not sure whether Public transport is available for this place or not, but visitors can take metro till ibn batuta mall and from there they can hire a cab. Getting Cab is not diffficult at all. Visitors can also take Prasad, the temple is open from early morning till 9 late evening.

Vahe Guru. An awesome place that lightens your mind, body and soul. Great place to visit. Excellently done prayer hall. The Guru Granth Sahib and rendering of Kirtans are the main attractions.Of course, the biggest and best Langaar.Vahe Guru
India Pakistan Bhai Bhai. Very near to Dubai Musiam Masjid where we can see and realise Bhai Bhai. Very calm religious Gurudwara.

Gurudwara in Dubai. The Giridwara is newly constructed Gurunanak Darbar. The Sikh Temple is in land side of the Red Metro line in Jebel Ali. The place is well maintained inspire of the crowd in weekends.
Very good peaceful place. its a nice place to visit, make you feel away from the hustle and bustle of busy Dubai. a quiet place to meditate on the Lord
"Peace of mind". A very newly opend Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple in Jabel Ali is truly gives me a Peace of mind. Connection through Soul to God. The best feel here.
Waheguru Waheguru. Being hindu it was so great religious feeling when i had been inside the Nanak Saheb Temple. Superbly maintain.
Visit to Jabel Ali Gurudwara. Visited with my family. Very nice neat and clean Gurudwara. You feel the divine presence there. Langar was really very good

Beautiful, peaceful temple.. Me and my husband went to visit this temple, we were based in Jumeriah Beach so this temple is a bit far out. We asked the hotel to get the taxi person to take us to the temple and wait for us and bring us back as this is a bit far out if you don't have a car. It was beautiful from the outside and from the inside it was so peaceful. make sure you are dressed appropriately. We recommend people to go this temple and experience the beauty.
Beautiful Gurdwara. Beautiful gurdwara in dubai. Need to get taxi to get here. It is near the Ibn Battuta Mall.20 mins walk to the mall.
A peaceful place..... A beautiful , peaceful place. A perfect place to meditate for visitors after a tiring day out in the sun.
A must visit... Excellent, a must visit, and ensure your dressed appropriately (no shorts). Its around 30 mins drive from Dubai city

Gurdhwara in Dubai. Visited with friends from the UK. Had not known that it was so close to where I live. The only thing is that is high percentage of men that go due the Indian workforce in Dubai. Will go again with visitors.
Thank you. Nice, peaceful and beautiful building. I love this place. We meditated there. And we received good meal there....

Lovely and peaceful. Its a place of worship but very well maintained. Clean and well organised the Gurunanak Darbar Sikh Temple is a great visit for Non Sikhs too. Peaceful atmosphere and soothing Singing of the "sabads"from the Guru Granth Sahib is lovely to listen. Langar is free for all and tasty too. Must experience.
Gurdwara in Dubai!. Visited during the wedding of a close friend. Well worth a visit for all visitors to Dubai. The decor is something to see.

Divine Place for spiritual experience. Divine Experience, must visit Gurudwara of Dubai and the world, with all required Amenities for a spiritual experience. Wahe Guru Ji Ka Khalsa Wahe Guru Ji Ki Fateh
DO not miss it. Had a very peaceful experience in the gurudwara. The bhajans in the prayer room was out of this world.
Peace. Peaceful worship place...feels calm. Langar is served all day..service done with love..easily accessible from Sheikh Zayed, plenty of parking.
Dont miss it.. Very beautiful and such a lovely experience since I wasn't familar with the Sikh faith. The architecture is totally amazing.
must visit for all indians. gods own place..reminds me of back home when i come here.selfless serving and amazing ambience. peace rules
Mann ki Shanti. A very peaceful and divine atmosphere awaits you within the big temple complex. Be sure to have traditional Langar in the premises which is served with utmost Seva Bhav.
Very peaceful. Very clean, peaceful and serene. Lifts available and head scarfs for for both men and women. Plenty of parking available.

A very good way to start your excursion trip having it as the first destination.. Close to Jebel Ali port, the temple is well constructed inside and out. Went during the day time. The langar was very tasty. Not that we were in for that :). Langar for all who are not familiar with the word is what is served as food as god blessings for people who visit the temple and sit for it. It's not a compulsion however to sit for it. Langar is served on the ground floor and the darbaar in on the first floor. The darbaar sitting area was huge and fully carpeted. It was very well maintained and neat and clean. The colours used are very soothing and apt for the meditative experience. A very good experience to start the day off.

Beautiful gurdwara, but ensure travel is pre-arranged. The Guru Nanak Darbar is beautiful, and peaceful Gurdwara. Recommended for anyone visiting Dubai.Word of warning... The temple is off the main roads, in a somewhat remote location. If you are visiting ensure you have return travel pre-arranged. My wife and I took a taxi to the temple, but if it wasn't for a kind individual, who dropped us to the closest taxi rank, would have been stuck there for some time. Apparently the temple do some form of mini bus shuttle service, but must be pre-arranged with the temple directly.

A Haven for Tranquillity and Peace. The Gurunanak Darbar happens to be one of the few places where you can go and find inner peace. The lovely Main darbar offers tranquil shabad all throughout the day and then there are inner rooms where you can meditate in peace or read spiritual text.For those who seek inner peace and tranquillity there is no better place and what's best is that people from any religion, nationality and cast can freely come by and will be welcomed.Must visit in case you really want to experience the Multi Cultural side of Dubai at its best.
Guru Nanak darbar" peaceful and serene. Dubai is really a blend of cultures from across the world .The Gurunanak darbar in Jebel Ali is a beautiful Sikh temple, very peaceful and serene.

Sat Shri Akal ji. Sat Shriakal...... Peaceful, Graceful, and the best place in Dubai along with the Temple in Bur Dubai + Jebel Ali to relax and unwind your mind n heart in the company of Wahe Guruji and Shri Sai Baba, Shri Ram and Shree Hanuman :)
Get some time off for some solitude time.. It's always nice to visit Gurudwaras abroad. Slightly hard to find but well worth a visit.Brings inner peace, serenity and spiritual understanding.

Beautiful and very well maintained sacred place. This Gurudwara entertains people from all region and if you are true believer in Guru nanak ji, then you must visit this place when in Dubai. The langar here is so refreshing and the purity of this place makes u love it.
Very Peaceful. Amazing Architecture. Very Peaceful. The management is also fantastic. Its very busy on the weekends (friday and saturday)

Peace. Visit anytime and you will find peace.. the setup is vibrant and there is a positive vibe.. they serve food or snacks depending on the time of visit.. the food is pure and filling.. the kanav prasad which is a delicacy of Sikh temples is out of this world. Sikh Holy Temple. This is perhaps the only Sikh Temple in Dubai. As this is a Sikh Temple, it has a religious significance to them. Most of them will go to the temple on their day off or on special occasions. Exactly what Sikh's do in a Sikh Temple is exactly what other people do when they visit their respective religious institutions, mosques or churches or synagogues etc. However, one thing which is unique about Sikh Temples is that there is always a communal meal available to anyone at appropriate meal times at a Sikh Temple. This communal meal is called "Langer" and is taken while seated on the floor. Everybody sits together as an equal, and shares the same food. There is no distinction of any class or status. The food is all prepared by volunteers from the community, and anyone can participate. Food items are also donated by the community, in whatever quantity you please. There is absolutely no compulsion, but only that no alcohol and meat is to be brought in. The whole operation of preparing the food, serving, and cleaning etc is all carried by volunteers with no compulsion.

Jo bole so nihaal.... If we cannot open our minds to be accepting of other peoples' faiths, we do not leave a world of hope or a future for our children.When I become the ruler of the world, this will be my first decree: that our children learn something of other people's faiths. With love and respect. They can start here, at the Sikh gurudwara (translates to 'the door of the Guru,' meaning the Creator).This Sikh temple is usually on my list for visitors to Dubai. It is worthwhile to show our guests the enormous area in Jebel Ali that has been granted by the Rulers to people of different faiths, so that they can practise their faiths in peace.The Sikhs are people of the Book, they believe in One God, and do not practise idolatry. Each person that visits the Sikh temple is equal - man and woman - and is welcome to join in prayer, in partaking of the food at the Community kitchen, the langar, or even in serving the community. The food is simple, vegetarian fare. Most of the people serving the food, or cleaning up are volunteers.What do you need to do as a visitor? cover your head with a scarf or a large, clean handkerchief. There are fresh scarves available at all levels, in baskets. There is a neat, assigned place for footwear, for which you will get a token in return - no payment involved.The Guru Granth Sahib is the holy book of the Sikhs and they bow to the book, or more importantly, to the Word carried in the book. Spend a few moments in reflection or prayer. You can ask one of the officials to say a prayer for you or answer any questions about the faith. They will be happy to oblige.There is no mandatory payment but the decent thing would be to place a small amount as an offertory that would cover the expense of the meal that you partake of. The entire kitchen works only on donations, and the doors are open to all peoples.

Great Place, working Sikh Temple. This is a beautiful place and a great place to see a live working Sikh temple. Word of caution to tourists, there are not any tourist destination spots here like a visitor center so be prepared to respectfully observe those who have come here to worship.

Best Modern Gurudwara. I attended an Anand Karaj here and spent a good 4 hours here as a result. The place is made amazingly well and seems like a five star hotel but with sense of peace and tranquil only a Gurudwara can offer. All the Guru readings are displayed on the two projectors which makes following very easy. Truly amazing experience.
Peaceful. Nice to see a Sikh Gurdwara in Dubai. It's bit far from the city, but is peaceful and is worth a visit.

Satnam - place of worship, good food and courteous people. It may not be on your tourist list, but if you want to visit a true Sikh temple and have not done so in India or elsewhere, please pay a visit. The place is clean and well organised, the ragis (singers who sing the gurbani or the devotional songs) have wonderful soulful voice and music and if you are keen on sitting on the floor and eat free food, called Langer, you would be surprised with such simple but tasty food. Those whoa re interested could offer their service in serving fellow diners.
Sikh Temple. This is a must for all sikhs to visit as well as non sikhs. it is on outskirts. The architecture is beautiful inside and outside. The water feature around the Temple is nice.
Heavenly Experience !!!!. Awesome place. The way it is currently being maintained by Sangat is brilliant. A must visit place if you are in and around dubai ...

A sacred place to visit in dubai. A very calm and quite sacred place. From outside it looks massive. one looking for a quite and solace can visit the temple and will never be dissapointed.It is very cliean and well organised, the members are very polite and helpful.A big prayer hall which can gather a huge mass of devotees gives a very pleasnt experience.
Its huge and gives a sense of Peace!!. Made very well.....just gives you a great feeling once your in there! Crowded on Weekends but rest of the week is fine.
Nice Sikh Temple. For the devout kisks this is a nice accessible Gurudwara and make and i believe lot of crowds on ocassions. Definitely worth a visit.
Worth visiting. Very clean and well maintained Gurdwara . The location is somewhat interior have to take taxi from Ibn Batuta metro station.
It is a divine place.. Says a home away from home. This is the most beautiful I have ever see before, does't matter which religion you're from or which country.
pleasant. Had visit with family. had pleasant atmosphere. make sure that you have enough time to sit and feel good.

Spiritual and Divine. Does't matter which religion you're from or which country, if you want to be in a place where you can see a remarkable convergence of all religions, spirituality and seek peace, this place is a must go.
The community has done a great work in establishing the Gurudwara here and its a life changing experience for sure.

Holy. It is a divine place. You don't feel like you are in Dubai, absolutely serene. People there are always helpful and caring.
Langar (free food for all) as a prasad is all time tasty & filling. Lovely ambience & peaceful atmosphere makes this place out of the city.

Peace full place. This is a peace full and good place ....and amazingly its in Dubai - Middle East ....every day in afternoon / evening you get food ....simple and delicious which is so called LANGAR....by the devotees

Unity in Diversity. It was a pleasant surprise for me to see a Gurudwadra and Hindu Temple in a purely Muslim gulf country. It greatness of Dubai Ruler to allow other religions to worship as per their belief.
Peace. Well what can you say, you go to Dubai and can take the opportunity to visit a Sikh temple that does refresh you, just take your time and let the temple do its thing, beautiful place
great food. always a pleasure to visit this place. bliss, harmony, tranquility and the most simple yet tasty food.
Religious. This sikh temple has an extra ordinary building, very artistically made. Such a poise place, very calm. Langar is very tasty with nice sitting arrangements.
gurunanak darbar sikh. It is the only heaven in the earth which the dubai government allows to buit the gurudwara where a person can go and fells the refresh.

Must visit for people from all religion. Beautiful, serene, quiet place to spent some quality time. A must visit if you are with parents, especially North Indian :-)
And the Langar is awesome, as usual.
Excellent!. This is a supremely calm place to go spend a couple of hours. Visited with my family - just sat down in the peaceful hall and walked around the complex. Worth a visit!

A serene place. Calm, Serene and peace of mind. Just the perfect place of worship. Even with a extremely large crowd on the New Year Friday it was perfectly handled by the volunteers.
Spend some time and also partake the langar.

Heartwarming. Such a calm atmosphere, so soothing to mind, body & soul. Just go there and recharge yourself. Whenever I visit the Darbar, I feel thankful to HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Makhtoum for his cosmoplitan views and openness for other cultures. Wicked place. This is my second time to the temple and I loved it better this time. As a UK Sikh I had to visit here and take my family here to see how great a place it is. The sewadar were great and we got to see the kitchen which is normally restricted. I want to thank Sheikh Makatoum for his donation and allowing the sikh population to have such a home in UAE.
Very Nice!. Located far away from the bustling and fast moving Dubai. This is a calm/serene place to go spend a couple of hours!

bit disappointed. While it was classified as the number 1 attraction of Dubai, we were really determined to go there. And it proved to be a chalenge to come there. Even with a privat car with local driver it was not easy. We were brought to an officer who gave us a little tour. He told us some interesting things about Sikhreligion and the temple. Although it was a nice place to visit, I have no idea why it is classified as nummer 1 attraction, there was not very much to see. In my opiom it can' t compare to many other attractions in Dubai.

Authentic and Atmospheric. In a city of artificiality, this temple is wildly atmospheric. The devotees are fascination to watch (do so discreetly). You won't find many colorful experiences like this in Dubai.
Serenity in Dubai. Absolutely peaceful. The sevadars are doing a great job too. Its great how the management has maintained the Gurudwara so well and have paid attention to every detail.

Nice. Its Better and getting Best Now.
Located Near Ibn Battuta Mall, Free Quality Food(Langar)

Osum Place. Never seen a gurudwara like this and it is made beutifuly will all facility . It is in outskirts of Dubai with huge space and langar being served at all times. During weekend we have programs due to which there is huge rush. It is at 1 number in most attractive places in Dubai
Amazing..... Very peaceful, great kirtan & langer (free food). Definitely worth visiting. Was told Fridays are the busiest days to meet sangat (congregation). Only 17 dirhams (£3) from JBR.

it's nice but long trip. well if you don't have a car or get a cab it will be kind of a long trip for you to go there.

just make sure you get a ride

Heaven for Sikhs in Dubai. A beautiful sikh temple in Jebel Ali built more than 2 years ago is one of the best outside India which has a very large prayer hall and 3 storey basement parking. Peaceful. A place away from crowd, can spend hours listening to Kirtan and finding inner peace!

Serenity Amidst The Chaos. A beautifully tranquil holy place, built with the same level of awe as the rest of Dubai..except here serenity reigns, amongst the hustle and bustle that is Dubai. The Sikh people are extremely hospitable, experience first hand their hospitality; with free food being served to all that come (not just Sikhs), as well as a spiritually welcoming invitation into the World of Sikhism.
